    • Field Detail

      • ALPHABET_SIZE

        public static final int ALPHABET_SIZE
        (Huffman coding) Size of the array used to store character frequencies, or how many unique characters there are. In this case it is the different values of one byte.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CODE_LENGTH

        public static final int CODE_LENGTH
        (LZW) Specifies how many bits are read at one time as one value.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Starts the program. Used for testing.
        Parameters:
        args - arguments from the user

      • start

        public static java.lang.String start(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main program for compressing. A character is assumed to be one byte long. In the case it is not, the program will still work, just not as efficiently space saving wise. The command argument is either hc/hd for Huffman compress/decompress, or lc/ld for Lempel-Ziv-Welch compress/decompress.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments are: command, source, destination.
        Returns:
        description of the events
